node.title: 'Blows up like a bomb': Residents closest to major scrub fire in Northland say they've been living in uncertainty and anxiety
node.description: The major scrub fire in Northland has been going on for a month.
node.content: ["Those living in the Far North settlements closest to the scrub fire that's been raging for more than a month say they have been living in uncertainty and anxiety.", "Evacuated twice from their homes at the end of last year, they're braced for more upheaval, but amongst the fear, the tight-knit community has left them feeling truly grateful for all that they have.", "The size and duration of the fire in Northland has made it among the largest in recent history in New Zealand, and it's also one of the most complex.", "Paddy Horne, 74, slept in his car for four nights when the Waiharara fire threatened to burn down the home he shares with his wife of 52 years.", "\"She slept in her car and I slept in my car,\" Kaimaumau resident Horne said.", "\"She had the cat with her and I had the dog.", "\"It's one of those situations where you do what you have to do for the moment in time.\"", "More than four weeks on, the fire continues to burn through peat and wetlands with last weekend's Cyclone Cody whipping up winds to further fuel the flames.", "Experienced firefighters have been away from their homes for weeks, employing every strategy to tackle the blaze which started a week before Christmas. The fire now covers more than 2500 hectares.", "\"The difficulty of the fire is right up there because of the different terrain, the swamp in very hot weather and the very dry weather,\" fire incident controller Peter Clark told Newshub.\u00a0", "Wh\u0101nau says it's the uncertainty now that's the hardest thing to contend with. Each day is different from the next and they feel very much in limbo.", "\"You get to the stage where the clouds start looking like smoke, and you've got to go get out and check it properly,\" Kaimaumau resident Rosey Cook-Toamau told Newshub.", "\"It is quite stressful, every day is different.\"", "Cook-Toamau and Dixie Cook-Tamati have been on the frontlines of the fire helping crews make sure no one goes beyond this blockade, which still sees flare-ups.", "\"This bush is right behind us so we have to move quickly,\" Cook-Tamati told Newshub. \"It just blows up like a bomb.\"", "Residents in this seaside settlement call it paradise but after two evacuations, the possibility of a third is ever-present.", "Precious photos and mementoes that hung from their walls remain packed in their cars, ready for a quick getaway.", "\"It's really tiring, wondering whether we're going to go, whether we're going to stay, whether we're going to lose everything,\" local resident Bernice told Newshub.", "\"Like every night you'd wake up and look out the windows to make sure you couldn't see it coming any closer.\"", "The anxious sleepless nights have caught up on Bernice, last week the stress became too much and an ambulance was called after she collapsed.\u00a0\u00a0", "\"We won\u2019t be the only families suffering from this sort of issue,\" Horne said. \"We were just lucky that we got the help from St John ambulance and all that.\"", "But for all the stress, there has been something to celebrate as the locals have become closer, forging bonds to know their neighbours.", "\"We got to know people that we never met before,\" Cook-Tamati said.", "\"The family usually sticks to themselves, but the ones that were in the village, we actually got to meet some that we've never met before.\"", "Clark has been working for the fire service for more than 30 years and says he's never met a more resilient and generous community.", "\"People are bringing in biscuits and home-baked cookies, one person was even offering haircuts to one of our firefighters,\" Clark said. \"That's the community spirit.\"", "Cook-Tamati said: \"We're just so lucky to have the fire department out there, doing the work they're doing.\"", "For a fire that could have caused so much heartbreak, the people of Kaimaumau say they've never been so thankful for what they hold dear.", "\"If we can look after each other and help each other through tough times and good times, so be it and that's what we do,\"\u00a0Horne said.", "Bernice said: \"It's your lives that are more important than your material things.\"", "\u00a0A valuable lesson that emerged from the smoke and flames.", "Watch the full story above.\u00a0"]
